title: ISI-linked arms racket busted: 10 foreign pistols, 92 live cartridges seized; smuggled from Pak
content: Delhi Police have busted an international arms smuggling ring with suspected ISI links, arresting four individuals. Sophisticated foreign-made weapons, including Turkiye-made PX-5.7 pistols, were seized, having been smuggled via drones from Pakistan. This significant operation aims to dismantle a network intending to destabilize the region.

title: 'An oversight’: Al-Falah University's 1st reaction to NAAC notice
content: Al Falah University admitted an "oversight" regarding outdated accreditation on its website, removing the information after a NAAC show-cause notice. This follows an Enforcement Directorate probe into alleged financial irregularities, with the group's chairman arrested. Investigators suspect siphoning of funds, with crores generated from education receipts allegedly diverted to family-linked entities.

title: Ex-CIA officer mocks Imran’s PTI over apology demand; asserts Pak can’t beat India in war - watch
content: Former CIA officer John Kiriakou claims Pakistan demanded an apology for his assessment of a conventional war with India. He also alleged the US "purchased" then-President Musharraf and that the Pentagon controlled Pakistan's nuclear arsenal in 2002. Kiriakou recounted Osama bin Laden's escape into Pakistan and stated India had the right to retaliate after terror attacks.

title: Europe has a new fear: China may 'stop its' buses right on roads
content: European nations, particularly Denmark and Norway, are scrutinizing Chinese-made Yutong buses over security fears. Operators worry that 'over-the-air' software updates could allow remote immobilization of the fleet, mirroring concerns over Chinese tech in 5G networks. This potential vulnerability, inherent in connected vehicles, raises geopolitical questions about reliance on foreign manufacturers.

title: 'World will cease to exist without Hindus': RSS chief Bhagwat speaks in Manipur; quotes Iqbal
content: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat stated that the world wouldn't exist without Hindus, citing the community's enduring identity. During his visit to Manipur, he urged unity and character-building for peace, emphasizing solutions within the constitutional framework and dialogue based on oneness. Bhagwat also acknowledged historical roots of regional tensions in colonial policies.

title: Bank holiday today: Are banks open or closed on November 22? Check details
content: Bank branches nationwide are closed today, Saturday, November 22, 2025, as it is the fourth Saturday of the month, a uniform holiday for banks. Customers needing branch services should plan for the next working day, as digital services and ATMs remain operational for essential transactions.

title: Jaipur school suicide: Student sought teacher's help 5 times, says CBSE report
content: A Jaipur school faces a CBSE show-cause notice after a Class 4 student died by suicide, reportedly due to 18 months of classroom bullying. The inquiry found the school failed to act on repeated complaints, with the class teacher ignoring the child's distress in her final moments. Safety lapses and a non-responsive grievance mechanism were also highlighted.

title: ‘Rivals closing in’: Altman warns of Google, Anthropic push - what memo to ChatGPT employees said
content: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman acknowledged Google's AI advancements could temporarily impact the company, but expressed confidence in catching up.  Despite ChatGPT's user engagement cooling, Altman urged employees to focus on achieving superintelligence, emphasizing OpenAI's strength to navigate competition from rivals like Google and Anthropic, even as Google benefits from cloud services.

title: Watch: Passenger cooks noodles in train in electric kettle; Railway fumes
content: A passenger's viral video of cooking instant noodles in an AC coach using a household electric kettle has prompted Central Railway to take action. The railway authorities identified the social media user and will initiate proceedings under the Railways Act for misusing railway property and posing a fire hazard.

title: Amazon layoffs: Documents filed in multiple US cities; shows engineers were worst hit
content: Amazon is cutting approximately 14,000 corporate jobs, with nearly 40% of those in affected states being engineering roles, particularly mid-level software engineers. These layoffs, the largest in the company's history, are attributed by CEO Andy Jassy to a cultural shift towards leaner operations and efficiency gains, not primarily AI or financial reasons.

title: Revealed! 'That was on me': Jitesh explains choice to bench Suryavanshi in Super Over
content: India A captain Jitesh Sharma accepted responsibility for their semi-final loss to Bangladesh in the Rising Stars Asia Cup. The controversial decision to not bat Vaibhav Suryavanshi in the Super Over backfired, with Jitesh and Ashutosh dismissed for golden ducks. Despite a strong start and a late surge, India A narrowly missed out on a tie, ultimately falling short.

title: 'Fascist, jihadist next to each other?' Trump-Mamdani grilled at WH meet - watch viral moment
content: In a surprising turn, US president Trump and NYC Mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani met cordially, discussing shared goals for the city's affordability and safety. Despite past animosity, they focused on housing and utility costs, with Trump even defending Mamdani against accusations. This unexpected dialogue signals a potential shift in their relationship.

title: Manipur crackdown: Four militants arrested; men linked to banned groups carried out extortion
content: Security forces in Manipur have apprehended four militants from banned groups involved in extortion activities. The arrests, made in Thoubal and Imphal West districts, led to the recovery of weapons, ammunition, and incriminating documents. These operations are part of ongoing efforts amidst the state's persistent ethnic violence.

title: ‘Clothes torn’: Marine engineer’s wife ‘strip-searched’ at Lucknow shop
content: A marine engineer's wife was allegedly assaulted, strip-searched, and publicly humiliated at a Lucknow crockery shop after being accused of theft. She filed an FIR against the shop owner, his family, and employees. The shopkeeper has filed a counter-allegation, claiming the woman and a companion stole plates.

title: LiAngelo ball goes platinum with breakout hit “Tweaker” featuring Drake
content: LiAngelo Ball, formerly a basketball player, has achieved a major milestone in music. His debut single 'Tweaker' has gone platinum. This success signifies a significant crossover from sports to the entertainment industry. The song became a cultural phenomenon, embraced by sports teams and charting highly. Ball's journey redefines his public identity and highlights his artistic ambition.

title: Sabrina Carpenter snubs Swift’s Marvel debut to plan wedding with Travis Kelce
content: Pop culture is abuzz as Sabrina Carpenter reportedly meets with Marvel for the Dazzler role, reigniting debate over Taylor Swift's potential casting. Fans long envisioned Swift as the music-powered mutant, citing her stage presence and pop icon status. While Carpenter offers a fresh take, Swift's connection to Dazzler remains a captivating 'what if' for many.

title: CGBSE class 10, 12 exam 2026 time table released: Check complete schedule here
content: Chhattisgarh Board has announced the 2026 Class 10 and 12 exam schedule. Practical exams are set for January, with theory papers commencing in February. Class 12 exams begin February 20th, followed by Class 10 on February 21st. Students are urged to download the official PDF for precise details and prepare diligently.

title: AP SSC 2026 board exam schedule released: Check subject-wise dates here
content: Andhra Pradesh's SSC Class 10 exams for 2026 are set to commence on March 16th and conclude by April 1st.  Students will tackle core and elective subjects, with most exams scheduled from 9:30 AM to 12:45 PM.  Shorter sessions are allocated for science and vocational papers.  Verify your schedule and arrive early.

title: Delhi boy 'suicide': Police secure CCTV footage showing Class 10 kid 'humiliated'
content: Police are investigating the suicide of 16-year-old Shourya Patil, who allegedly jumped from a metro station after facing days of humiliation by teachers. His classmates reported threats of expulsion and physical altercations. A suicide note found in his bag details alleged harassment by four teachers, who have since been suspended by the school pending investigation.

title: Dubai Tejas crash: Who was Wing Commander Namansh Syal? IAF pilot who died in incident
content: Wing Commander Namansh Syal, a proud son of Himachal Pradesh, tragically lost his life during a Tejas aircraft crash at the Dubai Air Show. Hailing from Kangra district, Syal was a decorated officer with a distinguished career, having trained at Sainik School and the National Defence Academy.

title: 38th captain, 8th toss lost: Rishabh Pant continues Team India's coin flip woes
content: India's toss woes continue as Rishabh Pant loses the coin flip to South Africa's Temba Bavuma in Guwahati. South Africa elected to bat first on a pitch expected to favour batters initially. India made two changes, including Sai Sudharsan and Nitish Kumar Reddy, while South Africa bolstered their spin attack.

title: India retail shift: Tier II–III cities powering new phase of real estate growth
content: India's retail boom is shifting beyond metros, with Tier II and III cities now leading organized retail expansion. Rising incomes and evolving consumer tastes for lifestyle experiences are fueling this growth. Cities like Raipur, Vizag, and Bhubaneswar are becoming key hubs, attracting brands and investors eager to tap into new, aspirational audiences.

title: Workforce reform! 4 labour codes made effective to simplify laws - check details
content: India's government has announced the implementation of four consolidated labor codes, effective November 21, 2025, to modernize regulations and strengthen worker protections. This significant policy shift rationalizes 29 existing laws, aiming to create a future-ready labor ecosystem that promotes formalization, ensures timely wages, and expands social security for all workers.

title: 'Communist' meets 'fascist': How Trump-Mamdani first White House meet went - 10 key moments
content: In a surprising White House meeting, Donald Trump and Mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani found common ground on New York City's future, despite stark ideological differences. Trump expressed a desire for Mamdani's success, emphasizing the city's importance. Discussions touched on immigration and public safety, with both leaders prioritizing a strong NYC, showcasing a rare moment of bipartisan cooperation.

title: Why STEM is the top choice for international students in the US: A deep dive
content: International students in the US are increasingly drawn to STEM disciplines, with a remarkable 57% opting for studies in science, technology, engineering, and math. This surge is fueled by the rising global need for expertise in fields such as computer science and AI, further supported by initiatives like OPT that grant valuable work opportunities post-graduation.

title: Bihar: Nitish Kumar cedes home to BJP's dy CM; JDU takes finance
content: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar has handed the crucial Home portfolio to Deputy CM Samrat Choudhary of the BJP for the first time in two decades. In return, JDU secured Finance. This move significantly boosts Choudhary's standing within the alliance, with the Home department's control over police and law & order considered politically vital.

title: CJI farewell: Gavai says anti-bulldozer ruling his most important; backs SC/ST sub-classification
content: Retiring CJI B.R. Gavai highlighted his judgment against "bulldozer justice" as his most significant, emphasizing its conflict with the rule of law and the right to shelter. He also cited the ruling allowing sub-classification of SCs and STs for reservations as crucial for addressing genuine inequality, quoting Ambedkar on the nuances of equality.

title: 'His body didn't allow ... ': Rishabh Pant gives major update on Shubman Gill
content: Rishabh Pant stepped in as India’s captain, replacing Shubman Gill, who was ruled out due to a neck injury sustained in the first Test. India also made two more changes, with B Sai Sudharsan and Nitish Kumar Reddy coming in for Gill and Axar Patel.

title: ISS shares breathtaking night views of world’s brightest cities
content: The International Space Station captured a stunning image of Earth at night. Delhi's bright lights stand out, showcasing its growth. The city is compared to other luminous megacities like Singapore, Tokyo, and Sao Paulo. These images reveal urban development and population growth. Orbital views offer insights into future city expansion and energy use.

title: Shutdown fallout: US scraps Oct inflation and jobs figures after data-gathering halt
content: US government data on October inflation and jobs won't be released due to a record shutdown, leaving the Federal Reserve blind ahead of its December policy meeting.  The Bureau of Labor Statistics confirmed the cancellations, citing an inability to collect essential survey information. This data gap intensifies uncertainty for the Fed as it considers interest rate adjustments.

title: India-Canada thaw: PM Modi to meet Carney at G20; leaders push to rebuild ties
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi and his Canadian counterpart Mark Carney will meet at the G20 summit in Johannesburg, aiming to rebuild ties strained by the 2023 killing of a Khalistan separatist.

title: Watch: Smriti Mandhana, Palash Muchhal’s cute Haldi moment melts the internet; fans swoon
content: India batter Smriti Mandhana and composer-filmmaker Palash Muchhal's wedding festivities have commenced with a vibrant Haldi ceremony. Held two days before their November 23 wedding, the event saw Mandhana, adorned in yellow, celebrating with family, friends, and teammates amidst traditional music and yellow decor. The intimate ceremony offered a colourful glimpse into the couple's wedding week.

title: Himani Shivpuri hesitates to address Aishwarya–Salman breakup
content: Veteran actor Himani Shivpuri, who shared screen space with Aishwarya Rai in Hamara Dil Aapke Paas Hai, Inaab, Loot Chale, and Tera Jaadu Chal Gaya, and later acted alongside Abhishek Bachchan in Umrao Jaan, reflected on her experience filming with the former Miss World. When asked about the much-publicised breakup between Aishwarya Rai and Salman Khan supposedly taking place during one of those film shoots, Shivpuri promptly declined to comment.

title: 'I’ll go when you go … Quiet, piggy': Kimmel hits back after Trump demands his firing
content: President Donald Trump reignited his feud with Jimmy Kimmel after the comedian’s blistering Wednesday monologue about the Epstein files and Trump’s Saudi state dinner. Within 11 minutes of the broadcast ending, Trump demanded ABC “get the bum off the air.” Kimmel hit back on Thursday’s show, mocking the president’s fixation and revisiting their September clash, as Trump simultaneously pressures networks to silence other late-night critics.

title: Ciara jokes about Russell Wilson being nosy during her chats with celebrities
content: Ciara, Kelly Rowland, and La La Anthony revealed Russell Wilson's playful and curious nature in their group chats.  Despite NFL challenges, Wilson actively joins conversations, offering genuine curiosity and honest advice, earning him a valued spot in their trusted circle. His presence brings humor and thoughtful input, strengthening their bond.

title: Dubai airshow crash: Demo ends in fatal hit; breaks Tejas’ near-flawless run since 2016
content: A Tejas fighter jet crashed during a Dubai Airshow demonstration, tragically killing IAF pilot Wing Commander Namansh Syal. The aircraft reportedly failed to recover from a negative G-turn. This marks the second Tejas crash since its induction, raising concerns for India's indigenous fighter project and its export ambitions. An inquiry is underway.

title: Ukraine-Russia conflict: Putin welcomes US peace plan as 'final settlement'
content: In a diplomatic twist, President Putin of Russia expressed a measured acceptance of a US proposal aimed at peace in Ukraine, indicating it might pave the way for a resolution. However, he criticized Kyiv for what he termed as an unrealistic stance.

title: Afghanistan trade push: Kabul offers tax breaks, 1% duty; seeks deeper ties with India
content: Afghanistan is wooing Indian investors with a five-year tax holiday for new industries and a 1% import duty on raw materials and machinery. Commerce Minister Nooruddin Azizi highlighted priority sectors like cement and textiles, urging Indian companies to invest. He also sought India's help in keeping the Chabahar trade route open amidst logistical challenges.

title: Ladakh violence probe: Panel warns against threats; urges eyewitnesses to 'speak freely'
content: A judicial commission investigating the Sept 24 Leh violence has warned against threatening eyewitnesses, assuring confidentiality for those who come forward. The commission, formed after demands from local political groups, is urging people to share information freely before hearings begin. Evidence submission is open until November 28.

title: Savannah James gets emotional as daughter Zhuri joins new SZN Volleyball team
content: Savannah James celebrated her daughter Zhuri Nova's milestone as she begins her volleyball journey with the popular SZN team. Despite her family's basketball background, Zhuri Nova chose a different athletic path. The proud mother shared heartwarming clips and reflected on Zhuri Nova's 11th birthday, highlighting her daughter's intelligence and confidence.

title: IPL: 'Destiny has got me to play with him'- Samson opens up on leaving RR for CSK
content: Sanju Samson is thrilled to join Chennai Super Kings for IPL 2026, eager to play alongside his idol MS Dhoni. Traded for Rs 18 Crore, Samson recalled his early admiration for Dhoni and the challenges of meeting him amidst crowds. He expressed immense excitement about sharing the dressing room, breakfast, and practice sessions with the legend.

title: ‘Save Banyan Trees’ representatives felicitated by Telangana CM Revanth
content: Telangana Chief Minister Revanth Reddy praises Parigi MLA T. Rammohan Reddy for pushing highway works

title: Kalaburagi study suggests a KMF-style cooperative cure for price volatility of vegetables
content: The study suggests a KMF-style overhaul of vegetable marketing; the model would allow vegetable farmers to sell directly to consumers, stabilise prices, and create a predictable market

title: Nine-month-old baby girl abandoned on express train rescued at Chennai Central
content: Despite a thorough search of all coaches, the parents could not be traced; further efforts to identify them are under way

title: Two BLOs die across two districts in M.P.; kin allege SIR survey work pressure
content: Relatives and friends of the deceased teachers-cum-BLOs, however, blamed heavy workload and pressure to meet enumeration targets as the reasons for the deaths

title: Nearly 18 acres of illegal poppy cultivation destroyed in Manipur
content: The State government had previously issued warnings against people engaged in widespread poppy planting

title: Chennai police arrest murder suspect after shooting him in the leg near Indira Nagar MRTS station
content: The suspect, Vijayakumar, 21, was tracked down by a special team while they were searching for suspects involved in the murder of Mouli, another history-sheeter

title: Powerful groups trying to divert attention from issue of illegal immigrants in Manipur: Biren Singh
content: Former Manipur CM Biren Singh also said anti-nationals and anti-State elements must not be allowed to distract from the real issue of infiltrators

title: No hasty implementation of labour codes in Karnataka, will discuss with unions: Santosh Lad
content: CITU Karnataka state committee called for a spontaneous protest at factory gates, taluk and district centres on Saturday and an organised protest on November 26, Constitution Day, at all district centres.

title: Stalin writes to PM Modi over Centre’s rejection of Coimbatore, Madurai Metro Rail projects
content: The rejection of the request has taken us by complete surprise, writes Tamil Nadu Chief Minister M.K. Stalin in a letter to Prime Minister Narendra Modi

title: Mulayam Singh birth anniversary: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath, other leaders pay tributes
content: Mulayam Singh Yadav, called 'Netaji' by his supporters, was born on November 22, 1939, in Saifai village in Etawah district

title: Maharashtra local body elections: BJP claims 100 councillors won unopposed days ahead of polling
content: Elections to 246 municipal councils and 42 nagar panchayats are scheduled for December 2, and votes will be counted on December 3, 2025

title: Supreme Court panel bans climbing stairs, offering darshan at Jagmohan hall of Banke Bihari temple
content: According to local customs and traditions, devotees are not allowed to enter the area, where only the priests on duty can facilitate worship offered by them

title: Tejas aircraft crash in Dubai: Wing Commander Naman Syal’s entire village in deep mourning
content: Relatives and villagers gathered in Naman Syal’s hometown, overwhelmed with grief, upon hearing the news of the tragic incident

title: Tracking the reported decline of Left-Wing Extremism: Infographics
content: 13 Maoists have been killed in separate encounters this week, in a serious setback for a declining movement

title: Centre raises MGNREGA work limit to 150 days for J&K for FY 25-26; L-G welcomes move
content: Department of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare had recommended extending the benefit of additional employment of 50 days over and above the 100 days per household under MGNREGA in the flood, cloud burst, and landslide-affected areas

title: Tejas fighter jet crash: Deeply saddened by loss of courageous IAF pilot during at Dubai Air Show, says HAL
content: The project to build the Tejas aircraft finally took off in 1984 after years of deliberations, and the jet was formally declared fit to fly in 2011

title: Pakistani drone sighted along International Border in J&K’s Samba; security forces search area
content: The drone, which was seen coming from the Chak Bhura post in Pakistan late Friday (November 21), hovered over Regal village in the Ghagwal area for a few minutes

title: Bank staff under scanner as Telangana cybercrime police link fraud cases to ‘insider’ roles
content: Cyber Security Bureau (TGCSB) is also pushing for the implementation of Reserve Bank of India’s MuleHunter.AI, an AI-based tool developed to trace and block mule accounts

title: Four former MLAs in the fray in local body polls this time
content: While the UDF has fielded Anil Akkara and K.S. Sabarinadhan, the LDF is fielding R. Lathadevi and K. Rajagopal

title: Supreme Court issues notice to Centre, BCI on plea related to POSH complaints by women lawyers
content: The petition argued that the Bombay High Court order has left women lawyers remediless, as the HC held that the POSH Act will not apply to bar councils

title: ‘Kodi Kada’ is in non-stop election mode
content: Since 1984, the small shop is the primary source of campaign materials for political parties across Kollam and neighbouring districts all through the year. It provides an array of customised products and strictly adheres to green protocol

title: History gives LDF a slight edge in north Kerala
content: As part of electioneering, while the LDF is championing the State government’s development and welfare schemes, the UDF is drawing attention to the ‘failures’ of the govt. and highlighting the row over gold theft in the Sabarimala temple. The BJP is no longer a political non-entity in Malabar

title: G20 Summit LIVE updates: PM Modi discusses investments in India’s digital ecosystem with South Africa-based Naspers; talks set to open today
content: Ahead of the summit in South Africa, PM Modi held talks with with Naspers chairman and CEO, and also met Australian PM Anthony Albanese

title: Telangana needs to be a global growth engine, and JNTU will power it, says Bhatti
content: Addressing the inaugural of Jawaharlal Nehru Technological University Hyderabad’s diamond jubilee celebrations, the Deputy Chief Minister described the institute as a ‘sacred place’ and ‘a national asset’

title: Amid MVA internal tussle, Sharad Pawar says ‘no comments’; Uddhav Sena confident he will mediate
content: Uddhav Thackeray’s party is a part of the MVA, but wants to align with Raj Thackeray for the upcoming local body elections

title: PM Modi meets Indian origin tech entrepreneurs, community members in Johannesburg
content: The Prime Minister also met members of the Indian community based in South Africa who are actively working with different community organisations

title: CJI Gavai bids adieu, says he is leaving Supreme Court as ‘student of justice’ with full sense of satisfaction
content: ‘I made an example of how a son of a senior IAS officer studying in Delhi at a premier school can be made to compete with the son of an agriculturist,’ the CJI said, recalling the creamy layer verdict

title: Government to propose guidelines defining ‘obscenity’ in online content
content: In a note shared with litigants in a Supreme Court case, the Union government put forward its proposal that will apply to all digital content  — social media platforms, OTT streaming services, and digital news platforms

title: In Kerala, a snakebite that sparked a change
content: Last month, Kerala declared snakebite envenomation a notifiable disease. Though snakebites are common in the State, a 2019 incident triggered a systemic overhaul. A 10-year-old girl had died of a venomous snakebite in a school in Wayanad, and people were outraged. Since then, a digital rescue network has been launched and school infrastructure upgraded. Sarath Babu George reports on Kerala’s quest for zero snakebite mortality

title: Demolition a political exercise in Varanasi, should be stopped, says Akhilesh
content: Mr. Yadav, who met the aggrieved traders of Varanasi’s Dal Mandi at the Samajwadi State Office in Lucknow, said that the political demolition of Varanasi Dal Mandi should be stopped

title: Sangai Festival begins in Manipur amid protest
content: The State’s Rajya Sabha member, Leishemba Sanajaoba, accuses an IPS officer of barging into his residential compound

title: When faction terror reached Hyderabad with blood, gore and bombs
content: The 1997 Jubilee Hills car bomb blast, which claimed 25 lives, brought Rayalaseema’s violent feuds to the capital city’s doorstep. Today, the site is just another bend in the road, but for those who witnessed the carnage, the memories remain sharp and unsettling

title: Telangana MLA’s plan to connect underserved Jukkal residents to top doctors through telemedicine
content: Local legislator Thota Laxmikantha Rao in talks with doctors of Christian Medical College-Vellore to collaborate for setting up telemedicine kiosks in the remote constituency; aim is to reduce dependence on distant hospitals and improve rural healthcare access

title: UVA shooter given max penalty of 5 life sentences
content: A judge sentenced Christopher Darnell Jones Jr. to the maximum allowable penalty of five life sentences, plus 23 years, for shooting and killing three Virginia football players in 2022.

title: Kiffin decision coming day after Egg Bowl, AD says
content: An announcement about Lane Kiffin's future will come the day after No. 6 Ole Miss plays rival Mississippi State in the Egg Bowl in Starkville on Nov. 28.

title: Stephen Jones: Pickens benched for missing bus
content: Cowboys receiver George Pickens missed the team bus to Monday's game against the Raiders, leading to him getting benched, co-owner and COO Stephen Jones told Dallas' 105.3 The Fan on Friday.

title: Source: 49ers voided Aiyuk's guarantees for 2026
content: During training camp, the 49ers voided the guaranteed money receiver Brandon Aiyuk has in his contract for 2026 because he had not been meeting the requirements of that deal, a league source said Friday, confirming a report by The Athletic.

title: Norris takes pole in wet Las Vegas qualifying
content: Lando Norris' march toward a first world title continued apace after he took pole position in a wet and perilous qualifying session at the Las Vegas Grand Prix while teammate Oscar Piastri could manage only fifth.

title: Franklin gets 5-year, $41.75M+ deal with Hokies
content: James Franklin's contract with Virginia Tech will net the Hokies' new coach at least $41.75 million over the next five years, according to a term sheet released by the school Friday.

title: Records: WMU police called twice to aid Kneeland
content: Western Michigan University police were twice called to perform welfare checks on former Cowboys defensive end Marshawn Kneeland while he played for the school.

title: Rangers' Garcia highlights non-tendered players
content: Rangers outfielder Adolis Garcia and catcher Jonah Heim headline the list of 66 MLB arbitration-eligible players who were not tendered contracts by their respective teams Friday.

title: 🏈 Reid's debut rankings for 2026 NFL draft
content: Jordan Reid unveils his initial rankings for the 2026 draft class, with the top 50 players, scouting reports and standouts at every position.

title: Clarity or more chaos? Breaking down the key games of Week 13
content: A Big Ten showdown in the West, playoff hopefuls trying hang on and the potential to clear things up in the ACC.

title: NBA Cup takeaways: Late-night drama unfolds in the West
content: The 2025 NBA Cup continued group play Friday. Here's everything you need to know about the third annual in-season tournament.

title: North Texas' QB guru can make a star out of anyone, even a player who was a high school backup
content: Eric Morris has tutored QBs from Patrick Mahomes to Cam Ward and John Mateer. How he mentors them is key to their successes and his.

title: The wild rise of BYU's Bear Bachmeier
content: Bachmeier has impressed with his talent and toughness, two traits honed through years of family battles.

title: NBA first-month lessons: What we're hearing on all 30 teams
content: Tim Bontemps takes the pulse of the league on OKC's chase for 70 wins, the potential post-Trae Hawks and more first-month standout storylines.

title: Pete Alonso's three most aggressive suitors so far -- and a few other fits for the free agent first baseman
content: For a second straight winter, the Mets' franchise home run king is seeking a long-term deal. Where might he land?

title: Should the Tigers trade Tarik Skubal? We asked around MLB
content: Will the best pitcher in baseball be on the move this offseason? Those in the game offer their advice.

title: Our guide to every Week 12 NFL game: Matchup previews, predictions, picks and nuggets
content: Another Eagles-Cowboys classic? Will Christian McCaffrey run through the Panthers? We have picks, stats and more for every game.

title: What makes Sarah Strong so good? The seven traits she shares with former UConn stars
content: Stewie's dominance. Taurasi's confidence. Collier's efficiency. UConn's Sarah Strong has all that -- and more.

title: NHL Power Rankings: 1-32 poll, each team's quarter-season MVP
content: The Avalanche's reign atop the list continues, and the Blackhawks break into the top 10. Here's the full list.

title: Grading preseason bold predictions for all 32 NHL teams
content: Some of our wild takes from September don't look so wild anymore. Others are way off base. Here's an update.

title: Early offseason needs for all 32 NFL teams: Positions to upgrade, draft prospects to watch, more
content: How can all 32 NFL teams improve during the offseason? We took an early look at positional needs, free agents to watch and intriguing draft fits.

title: Laurens' weekend preview: Derbies galore with Arsenal vs. Spurs, plus NWSL Championship
content: It's Friday and a full weekend of action awaits across the soccer calendar. So who better to tee up the best matches than Julien Laurens? In a new weekly feature, he picks out the best of the action ahead.

title: WNBA mock draft: There's a new No. 1 replacing Lauren Betts at the top
content: Four UCLA players, including Lauren Betts, are now projected first-round picks. But Spain's Awa Fam is No. 1.

title: Last-minute pickups for Week 12: Target the Brissett-Wilson combo in Arizona
content: If bye weeks or injuries have you seeking lineup help, consider the Cardinals passing game and a sneaky defense.

title: The Playbook: Lineup locks, Shadow Reports for Week 12
content: An all-encompassing look at matchups to exploit or avoid and lineup locks in fantasy, as well as projected scores.

title: Wetzel: Is the NCAA infraction system now too speedy to be fair?
content: In an effort to speed up infractions rulings, the NCAA implemented a new system in 2023 for low-stakes cases.

title: USC-Oregon: Why to bet on the Ducks' defense to prevail in Eugene
content: No. 7 Oregon is nearly a double-digit favorite at home against No. 15 USC, and the Ducks matchup up well against the Trojans' style of offense.

title: Expert picks, best bets: How Tsarukyan can reenter title contention
content: MMA experts give their predictions for a UFC Fight Night from Doha, Qatar, headlined by lightweight contenders Arman Tsarukyan and Dan Hooker.

title: How Mbappé's start at Real Madrid compares to greats like Ronaldo, Benzema
content: Kylian Mbappé has reached 75 games at Real Madrid in his best form since joining them. How does his start compare to some of the club's greatest strikers?

title: Transfer rumors, news: Inter eye move for Villa goalkeeper Martínez
content: Internazionale are reportedly considering a move for Aston Villa goalkeeper Emiliano Martínez. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Michigan State, other men's No. 1 class contenders, 5-star intel, more
content: Teams that won (Michigan State) and have work to do (Kentucky), plus the latest on uncommitted five-stars.

title: Deve Gowda, HDK re-elected JD(S) national and State presidents respectively
content: The party’s national council took a unanimous decision at the event to mark 25 years of formation of the regional outfit

title: 9,977 candidates file nominations in Kozhikode district
content: The scrutiny of the papers will be held on November 22, Nominations can be withdrawn till Monday November 24

title: Kalalaku Rekkalu, the girl student education scheme from next academic year, says Lokesh
content: HRD Minister Nara Lokesh reviews higher-education initiatives, announces a five-member committee to prevent student suicides and directs action against unapproved private colleges

title: Unlike Prime Minister, I will always meet fishermen: Stalin
content: Speaking virtually in a event held on the occasion of World Fisheries Day, he says the Centre must initiate strong steps to avoid the challenges and loss of lives suffered by the fishermen of Tamil Nadu in the hands of the Sri Lankan Navy

title: Punish those behind ‘lapses’ that led to Kashmir police station explosion: Mirwaiz, Ruhullah
content: Aga Syed Ruhullah termed it insensitive to have a tailor, a tehsildar, and a naib-tehsildar handling the explosives without a professional hand around.

title: First case registered against Christian missionaries under Rajasthan’s new anti-conversion law
content: The police have issued notices to the two pastors – Chandy Varghese from New Delhi and Arun John from Kota – while claiming that they promoted conversion and baptised several people during the programme

title: Malegaon shuts down as people demand justice for rape and murder of 3-year-old
content: Thousands gather outside Malegaon court demanding death penalty for accused in rape and murder of 3-year-old girl; police resort to lathi charge as protest turns violent.

title: Kalyan student’s death sparks probe into alleged train assault over language
content: Police say they are investigating claims that a 19-year-old was attacked on a crowded local train for speaking Hindi instead of Marathi

title: Initiative launched to help pensioners submit life certificate digitally
content: Under Secretary to Department of Pension and Pensioners Affairs says it will help ease the process through a mobile application Jeevan Praman

title: No non-teaching duties for teachers, says HRD Minister Lokesh
content: 200 issues have been resolved out of 423 brought to his attention by the Federation of Andhra Pradesh Teachers’ Organisations, Lokesh tells APTF leader

title: PAC questions FSSAI for unchecked sale of adulterated food items
content: The committee also drew attention to the Comptroller and Auditor General’s (CAG) report, which highlighted an acute shortage of manpower within the FSSAI

title: Punjab’s Tarn Taran by-poll verdict: Congress to take corrective measures, says Baghel
content: Congress party’s candidate Karanbir Singh Burj finished fourth, staying behind the Independent Mandeep Singh, who got almost 5,000 more votes than the Congress

title: Umar Khalid has ‘scant regard’ for Constitution, will quote Article 21 only for bail, Delhi Police tell Supreme Court
content: Khalid, other accused seeking bail after five years in jail as undertrials; police claim accused are delaying criminal proceedings; showing CCTV videos of 2020 riots, police say violence was pre-planned

title: Madras High Court quashes FIR booked against Aadhav Arjuna for inflammatory tweet
content: Justice A.D. Jagadish Chandira says the TVK leader, a beginner in politics, cannot be equated with a multi-faceted personality like S.Ve. Shekher

title: IWAI signs MoUs to enhance water transport and river tourism in the North East
content: A second MoU with the Government of Assam focuses on developing a water metro in Guwahati, Tezpur and Dibrugarh

title: INDIA bloc flays Centre for returning proposal for Metro Rail project for Madurai, Coimbatore
content: Union Government had not given the right reason for denying the Metro Rail project to the two major cities of Tamil Nadu, says senior leader of DMK Pon Muthuramalingam

title: Valley-wide crackdown on hospital lockers, car sellers continue
content: The police said the inspection drives were conducted “to ensure transparency and proper adherence to security protocols”

title: Stalin must speak with Congress high command to sort out Mekedatu issue, says Edappadi K. Palaniswami
content: He says that Karnataka does not have the right to construct the reservoir as per the Supreme Court verdict and criticises the Tamil Nadu Chief Minister for not responding to the issue

title: State to procure 10 lakh tonnes of maize; CM asks Centre to stop import
content: This year, maize production in the State is estimated at 55 lakh tonnes, and the government has decided to support farmers by opening procurement centres

title: Draft SOP for rallies, meetings submitted to HC proposes penal action against political parties
content: It says damage caused to private/public properties will be recovered by District Collectors apart from initiation of criminal prosecution

title: Terror Doctor's Big Confession On Plot To Carry Out Blasts Across India
content: The probe into the Delhi blast case has exposed a nefarious plan by the Jaish-linked white-collar terror module to carry out blasts across several Indian cities.

title: Andhra Student Jumps To Death Off College Building, Family Blames Varsity
content: A nursing student in Andhra Pradesh's Chittoor district died on Friday morning after she jumped from the fourth floor of her hostel building.

title: New Close-Up Shots From Dubai Show Tejas Wreckage Engulfed In Flames
content: A single-seat Light Combat Aircraft (LCA) Tejas fighter jet was executing a negative G turn before it slammed the ground.

title: BJP Ally Defends Son's Cabinet Entry With "School" Dig At Tejashwi Yadav
content: Former Union minister and Rashtriya Lok Morcha (RLM) chief Upendra Kushwaha on Friday defended the induction of his son, Deepak Prakash, into the Bihar Cabinet, asserting that the young leader is a qualified computer engineer.

title: Pilot's Father Saw Tejas Crash News While Scrolling Son's Air Show Videos
content: The father of Wing Commander Namansh Syal, who died in the Tejas crash yesterday, reportedly came to know about his son's death from YouTube.

title: Delhi Air Quality Remains "Very Poor", Fog Forecast For Today
content: There was no respite from toxic air for Delhi as it continued to face "very poor" air quality on Saturday, according to the Central Pollution Control Board (CPCB).

title: 80-Year-Old Mumbai Woman Duped Of Rs 1 Crore, Fraudsters Posed As Cops
content: An 80-year-old woman in Maharashtra's Dadar was duped of a whopping Rs 1.08 crore at the behest of fraudsters who posed as fake police and government officers.

title: Who Was Wing Commander Namansh Syal, Pilot Who Died In Dubai Tejas Crash
content: The 34-year-old pilot was a native of Patiyalkar village in the Kangra district of Himachal Pradesh. Syal is survived by his wife, also an IAF officer, their six-year-old daughter and his parents.

title: Video Shows Air Force Pilot Namansh Syal At Dubai Air Show Before Crash
content: Wing Commander Namansh Syal died after a Tejas fighter jet of the Indian Air Force he was flying crashed during an aerial display at the Dubai Air Show.

title: US Threatens To Cut Intel, Weapons To Press Ukraine Into Peace Deal: Report
content: The United States has threatened to cut intelligence sharing and weapons supplies for Ukraine to press it into agreeing to the framework of a US-brokered peace deal, two people familiar with the matter said.

title: Don't Let AI Do Your Homework, Pope Leo Tells US Youth
content: Artificial intelligence may be a useful tool for learning, but don't use it for your homework, Pope Leo told about 15,000 U.S. youth during a question-and-answer session on Friday.

title: "Most Difficult Moments": Ukraine Warns It May Lose US Ally Over Peace Plan
content: President Volodymyr Zelensky on Friday pushed back against a US plan to end the war in Ukraine, while Russian leader Vladimir Putin welcomed the proposal that includes many of his hardline demands.

title: "Will Have To Like It": Trump Gives Ukraine Deadline To Accept US Peace Plan
content: US President Donald Trump said Friday that Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky will "have to like" a US plan to end the war with Russia that calls for Kyiv to cede territory.

title: Video: Reporter Asks Mamdani If Trump Is A Fascist. His Response
content: During a meeting with New York mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani, President Trump struck a surprising tone, saying he would be "okay" if Mamdani continued to call him a "fascist", a label Mamdani had used previously during campaign rallies, CNN reported.

title: Key Takeaways From Trump-Mamdani White House Meeting
content: The two had called each other "fascist" and "communist," but when President Trump and New York City Mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani faced reporters in the Oval Office on Friday, they were just two iconoclastic New York politicians who were all smiles.

title: Trump Gives Warm Welcome To Zohran Mamdani At White House Meeting
content: President Donald Trump vowed Friday that his administration would work with New York's incoming Democratic socialist mayor Zohran Mamdani to improve life for residents of the US financial capital.

title: Israeli Military Says It Killed "13 Hamas Terrorists" In Lebanon Strike
content: Israel's military on Friday said a strike on a Palestinian refugee camp in southern Lebanon earlier this week had killed "13 Hamas terrorists".

title: BBC Board Member Resigns After Trump Documentary Edit
content: An independent director on the BBC's board, Shumeet Banerji, has quit on Friday in the wake of what the public broadcaster said was an incorrect edit of a speech by President Donald Trump and which has prompted the threat of a $5 billion lawsuit.

title: Women's class rankings: Texas up to No. 2 after early signing window
content: the longhorns already had two top-60 commitments, then signed two more elite recruits in no. 8 Brihanna Crittendon and no. 10 Addison Bjorn . despite smaller classes, no. 1 Saniyah Hall ( USC ), no. 2 Oliviyah Edwards ( Tennessee ), No. 3 Olivia Vukosa ( UConn ) and No. 6 McKenna Woliczko ( Iowa ) were all impactful developments .

title: Bearman: Vegas street track the 'least enjoyable'
content: Oliver Bearman says it's the "least enjoyable" street circuit he's ever driven . the f1 rookie says the circuit is "incredibly high speed, which is dangerous" he says the track itself is cool to be racing down the Strip in Las Vegas .

title: Projecting Round 1 of next year's draft
content: the 2026 draft is based on the standings through Week 11 . four teams currently have multiple first-round picks . the Rams ( from the Falcons ), the Browns (from the Jaguars ) and the Cowboys ( . from the Packers .

title: Rhodes attacked, AJ joins Rhea's War Games team
content: "SmackDown" was about teams that thrive and survive as Survivor Series: War Games approaches . AJ Lee is officially the fifth and final member of a group that includes Rhea Ripley, Alexa Bliss, Charlotte Flair and Iyo Sky .

title: Look at the 'ugly corners' for the best value in Week 13 of the CFB season
content: this week doesn't come with the shine of ranked matchups or brand-heavy teams . the best edges never show up in the games everyone wants to talk about . that's where these three plays come from .

title: 54 bids, 1 sale: Karl-Anthony Towns sells rare Yoshinobu Yamamoto MLB logo patch card for $72,000
content: new york knicks center Karl-Anthony Towns is collecting wins off the court . he is eighth on the NBA's player efficiency rating leaderboard for 2025-26 . in October, Towns pulled a one-of-one -signed MLB logo card from the 2024 Topps Inception set .

title: MLS playoffs conference semis preview: Can Cincy trio best Miami's Fab Four?
content: 'Futbol Americas' debates if the MLS play-off structure should be changed . MLS can conclude its 13-day pause to observe the FIFA window and resume its postseason . for each of these teams, the wait has actually been longer .

title: Do Don Mattingly and Dale Murphy belong in Cooperstown? Breaking down the contemporary era ballot
content: the contemporary era committee ballot will be announced on Dec. 7 . the writers have until the end of the year to determine their choices for the primary ballot . it's the stronger ballot; the eight candidates average 74.1 career bWAR .

title: How Baker Mayfield went from castoff to star: A wild 48 hours
content: Baker Mayfield was the 2017 Heisman winner at Oklahoma . he was the no. 1 pick by the Cleveland Browns in 2018 . but the loss of key players limits their chances against stronger teams in the NFC .

title: J&K: Pak drone spotted over Ghagwal area; forces sweep area for potential payload
content: The TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide. With an unwavering commitment to excellence in journalism, our team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics. title: 4 Codes replace 29 laws: Labour reforms set for rollout; rules within 45 days
content: four labour codes replace 29 laws; rules within 45 days . rollout comes within a week of a resounding electoral mandate in Bihar . biggest workforce regulation recast in decades is aimed at increasing employability of women .

title: Delhi breathes very poor air on 16 of 21 days in November
content: the city recorded the 16th very poor day in Nov as the air quality index (AQI) settled at 364 on Friday . it was 391 a day earlier . the earlier forecast suggested that AQI might turn severe on Saturday, but the latest one says that air quality is likely to remain in the very poor category .

title: Open letter from Gen Z: Are we the problem or just the mirror no one wants to look into?
content: a group often labeled "chronically online," "entitled," or "too sensitive," it’s ironic how rarely we’re truly heard . one of the biggest misconceptions about us is that older generations still mistake what they see as a “trend,” an “aesthetic” or a set of quirks for the entirety of who we are .
